description: Creates an archive of events with the specified settings. When you create an archive, incoming events might not immediately start being sent to the archive. Allow a short period of time for changes to take effect. If you do not specify a pattern to filter events sent to the archive, all events are sent to the archive except replayed events. Replayed events are not sent to an archive.

parameters.name: ArchiveName
parameters.description: The name for the archive to create.

parameters.name: EventSourceArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the event bus that sends events to the archive.

parameters.name: KmsKeyIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the KMS customer managed key for EventBridge to use, if you choose to use a customer managed key to encrypt this archive. The identifier can be the key Amazon Resource Name (ARN), KeyId, key alias, or key alias ARN. If you do not specify a customer managed key identifier, EventBridge uses an Amazon Web Services owned key to encrypt the archive. For more information, see Identify and view keys in the Key Management Service Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: ArchiveArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the archive that was created.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the archive that was created.

nested_items.name: StateReason
nested_items.description: The reason that the archive is in the state.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the archive was created.
